missions.name: Citadel: Alien Medi-Gel Formula
missions.description:
Dr. Ravin on the Citadel needs a new medi-gel formula created specifically for aliens. Find a new formula and deliver it to her at the Huerta Memorial Hospital. 

If you miss the terminal with this upgrade during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CerberusLab], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Barla Von
missions.description:
Liara sends you to speak to one of her Shadow Broker Agents - Barla Von. He reveals that there are Shadow Broker forces trapped in the Dranek system. Go rescue them and you can recruit them to the war effort. Return to Barla Von when the team is found. 

If you return before [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Citadel2], he will say that he is closing up shop on the Citadel. After the Citadel coup, his shop is empty with a round of bullet holes in the wall behind.

options.trigger: "What do you get out of this?"

missions.name: Citadel: Biotic Amp Interfaces
missions.description:
An asari on the Citadel is looking for improved biotic amp interfaces. Find schematics and bring them to her at the Huerta Memorial Hospital. 

If you miss the terminal with this upgrade during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GrissomAcademy], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Hanar Diplomat
missions.description: Salarian Spectre [megametracker://person?id=O3.Bau] suspects that a member of the hanar diplomatic staff is indoctrinated. If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Kasumi] is alive in Game 3, she will join this assignment.

missions.name: Meet Bau
missions.description: Meet Bau at the Citadel Embassy where he will reveal that he was leaked documents showing that the Alliance raided a batarian lab studying Reaper tech. There were hanar operatives there at the time, and they may have been indoctrinated. Those hanar are now part of the diplomatic delegation on the Citadel.

missions.name: Spectre Terminal
missions.description: Return to the Spectre terminal to investigate this claim, where Kasumi will talk to you if she is part of this. Select "Hanar Embassy Tracking" from the terminal to continue the assigment.

missions.name: Tracking
missions.description:
Head to the hanar embassy to track transfers there. 

You can find the first nav point at a terminal in the office suite. It reveals strange money transfers to two ambassadors. Bau clears Bolohn but is suspicious of Oloon. 

The second nav point is at the docks by the elevator. This one reveals that Oloon has been lobbying heaviliy for increased support of the war effort, indicating he is not indoctrinated. Bau turns his interest to the hanar opposing Oloon, a recent visitor from Kahje. 

Forward the names of recent hanar visitors via the terminal nearby. Bau will say it does not help, because those are face names and his records from the leaked raid documents are soul names. 

Head back tot he second nav point and forward Bau the hanar communications. From that he identifies [megametracker://person?id=O3.Zymandis].

missions.name: Confront Zymandis
missions.description: Return to the Embassies and head to the office suite on the left, where Bau will join you. Zymandis is inside, uploading a virus to the automated defense system on Kahje, the hanar homeworld. A human henchman attacks Bau at this point. If Kasumi is helping, you can save Bau and Kasumi will stop the virus. If she is not, you have to decide between Bau and Kahje. Each is a war asset.

missions.name: Citadel: Heating Unit Stabilizers
missions.description:
The salarian Sellea is overheard in the Presidium Commons by the C-Sec office saying he needs new heating unit stabilizers. Find them and bring them to him. 

If you miss the terminal with this upgrade during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CerberusFighterBase], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Improved Power Grid
missions.description:
The technician Alison inside the Purgatory entrance needs an improved power grid to keep things running. Find schematics for the new power grid and deliver them. 

If you miss the cannon with this upgrade during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CerberusAttack], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Krogan Dying Message
missions.description: During [megametracker://mission?id=A3.KroganTeam], you will find [Charr's|megametracker://person?id=O2.Charr] final message of love to [megametracker://person?id=O2.Ereba]. She is working at Nos Astra Sporting Goods in the Presidium Commons.

missions.name: Citadel: GX12 Thermal Pipe
missions.description:
[megametracker://person?id=P1.Adams] has requested a GX12 thermal pipe to make the Normandy's engines safer. Puchase one at Elkoss Combine Arsenal Supplies in the Presdium Commons and deliver it to him.

 If you speak to Adams afterwards, he will suggest sharing their research with the Crucible team, which results in the war asset Optimized Eezo Capacitors.

missions.name: Citadel: Cerberus Automated Turret Schematics
missions.description:
After the Citadel coup, you can find a C-Sec officer on a balcony at the top of the Presidium Commons. He needs a way to detect or deactivate Cerberus turrets left behind on the Citadel. Find the Cerberus automated turret schematics and bring them back to him. 

If you miss the schematics during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.Bomb], you can purchase them afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Batarian Codes
missions.description: C-Sec Officer Jordan Noles has requested assistance tracking illegal use of batarian diplomatic codes. Consult the Spectre terminal and then locate access points on the Citadel.

missions.name: Enable Access Codes
missions.description: Enable Spectre access at the terminal, so you can see the access points across the Citadel.

missions.name: Access Point 1
missions.description: In the right-side lab in Huerta Memorial Hospital.

missions.name: Access Point 2
missions.description: In the passenger lounge at the Normandy Dock Bay D24.

missions.name: Access Point 3
missions.description: At the end of Bay E28 in the Docks Holding Area.

missions.name: Balak
missions.description:
When you retrieve the final code, [megametracker://person?id=E1.Balak] sticks a gun to your back (if he did not die in Game 1). He blames Shepard for all the batarians have lost. If your reputation is high enough, you can spare his life (and receive a War Asset); otherwise you are forced to kill him. 

If Balak died in Game 1, you instead find Noles in Cargo Hold C, having arrested an angry batarian for the crime. You will have a similar reputation-limited option to earn him as an ally (but not to kill him).

missions.name: Citadel: Cerberus Ciphers
missions.description:
A C-Sec officer needs updated ciphers to break Cerberus codes. Find the ciphers and deliver them to him at the Citadel embassy. 

If you miss the terminal during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CommunicationHub], you can purchase the ciphers afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Cerberus Retribution
missions.description: A mob led by [masseffectracker://person?id=O3.Sommers] is planning to assassinate a Cerberus traitor. They are gathering at the C-Sec office in the Presidium Commons. Go there and decide whether to allow Sommers to kill the traitor or persuade him to let it go.

set.context: Talk to Captain Aaron Sommers after speaking to the arguing citizens

options.trigger: "Let me do it legally." or "Go ahead."

missions.name: Citadel: Cerberus Turian Poison
missions.description:
A doctor is looking for a Cerberus poison tailored to turians. Find a sample of the toxin and deliver it to the doctor in the Examination Rooms at Huerta Memorial Hospital. 

If you miss the poison during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.ExCerberusScientists], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Chemical Treatment
missions.description:
A doctor is looking for a way to treat a patient with chemical burns. Find a treatment plan and deliver it to the doctor at the left Lab Services area in Huerta Memorial Hospital. 

If you miss the poison during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7FuelReactors], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Inspirational Stories
missions.description: Film director [megametracker://person?id=O3.Vass] is looking for inspiring footage for his film. Film three stories in the refugee camp for him, and then return the footage to him at the Citadel docks security checkpoint.

missions.name: Memorial Wall
missions.description: Film a salarian consoling a grieving human.

missions.name: Card Table
missions.description: Film Vega and his friends playing cards.

missions.name: Operating Table
missions.description: There is a sick woman being treated near the refugee camp doctor.

missions.name: Talking
missions.description: A woman and a man are talking in the seated area.

missions.name: Citadel: Medical Supplies
missions.description:
Speak to Dr. Chakwas (or Dr. Michel) on the Normandy. She explains that the refugees on the docks have a large store of military grade medical supplies while the Normandy is equipped with an excess of supplies for treating contagion, exposure, and malnutrition - all things that refugees might suffer from. She suggests you negotiate a trade with the refugee leader, [megametracker://person?id=O3.Tactus]. 

When you have, return to the doctor on the Normandy. If it is Chakwas, you will get a +5 Health bonus; if Michel, you will get a +2 MediGel Capacity bonus. Glyph will also have a technology upgrade for healing any Renegade scars (if you didn't get that in Game 2).

missions.name: Speak to Tactus
missions.description: Ask Tactus to swap medical supplies with the Normandy.

missions.name: Citadel: Medi-Gel Sabotage
missions.description: You can overhear the clinic doctor in the Citadel docks refugee camp saying the medi-gel dispensers there have been sabotaged. And if [megametracker://person?id=P1.Conrad] wasn't killed in Games 1 or 2, you find out who the saboteur was.

missions.name: Conrad (Optional)
missions.description:
Conrad is in the Citadel docks, promoting Cerberus ("If Cerberus is good enough for Commander Shepard..."). Note: this is post-Citadel coup. Talk to Conrad and explain how terrible Cerberus is and that he should wise up about them. If you chose all the necessary Game 1 decisions (Conrad, Hossle's Disk on Feros, Asari Writings collection, and the Elkoss Combine Armory license), you will also get Conrad's dissertation as a War Asset. 

You can prompt Conrad for some more comments afterward. His charity for war orphans on Illium, whether we will defeat the Reapers, thermal clips, family on Earth, his shrine to Shepard. After that he will prompt you to go repair the medical station.

missions.name: Fix Medi-Gel Dispensers
missions.description: Find 3 of the 4 broken dispensers and fix them.

missions.name: Meet Conrad's Contact (Optional)
missions.description: Talk to the doctor again. Conrad will point out his Cerberus contact. The contact pulls a gun and Conrad takes the bullet for you-! If you helped [megametracker://person?id=O1.Rita] in Game 1, she will arrive and tell you that she previously sabotaged the Cerberus contact's gun, and Conrad is okay. Otherwise, he dies.

missions.name: Citadel: Reaper Code Fragments
missions.description:
An asari war stategist needs fragments of Reaper code to predict enemy movements. Find a Reaper code fragment and deliver it to her at the Embassy Offices at the Citadel embassies. 

If you miss the fragment during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.GethFighterSquadrons], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Target Jamming Technology
missions.description:
A C-Sec officer needs target-jamming technology to save lives during future attacks. Find the technology and bring it to him by Apollo's Cafe in the Presidium Commons. 

If you miss the terminal during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.AdmiralKoris], you can purchase it afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Citadel: Volus Ambassador
missions.description: A message from Primarch Victus implicates ambassador [megametracker://person?id=O1.DinKorlack] as a possible Cerberus informant. Investigate the ambassador at the Presidium Embassies.

set.context: Choosing between the turian colony and the volus fleet

missions.name: Spectre Terminal
missions.description: Locate Din Korlack on the Spectre Terminal. It says he's missing, but was last seen at an office suite near the human embassy.

missions.name: Office Suite
missions.description:
Speak to the turian guard outside the Citadel Embassy offices and convince him to let you into the office. Listen to the three recordings to learn that Din Korlack used to work for Cerberus but has severed any ties. [megametracker://person?id=S2.Zaeed] comes into the story if he survived Game 2. 

Find an earpiece in the office which connects you to Din Korlack. If Zaeed is with him, you can instruct Korlack to drop your name.

missions.name: Selkish Arms
missions.description: Head to the Selkish Arms apartments, to the apartment at the end of the hall. The first one you try will be wrong, so turn around and go to the apartment at the far other end *it* has Din Korlack and his captors inside. If Zaeed is here, the other merc are dead. If not, you kill them.

missions.name: A Choice
missions.description: Din Korlack is afraid that telling you what he knows about Cerberus will expose him. He will offer you the volus bombing fleet instead. If Zaeed is present, you can convince Korlack to give you both War Assets, otherwise the bombing fleet provides more readiness than the turian colony.

missions.name: Citadel: Wounded Batarian
missions.description: In the [Presidium Commons|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.C3.6Presidium&title=Civilians%20Discussing%20Ghorek&location=933x1299] you overhear two people talking about a batarian terrorist named Ghorek who is being held on the Citadel. Head down to the CItadel docks cargo section and he is in one of the back containers, sick and near death. After talking to him, you can choose to take him off life support, or leave him to suffer an agonizing death.

missions.name: Citadel: Asari Widow
missions.description: A dead asari commando, Tashya Porae, left behind a message at the Ardat-Yakshi monasteryfor her bondmate, Weshra. Find Weshra near Apollo's Cafe in the Presidium Commons.

missions.name: Aria: Blood Pack
missions.description:
Aria T'Loak has requested assistance uniting mercenary bands under her control. 

Speak to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Narl] in the Presidium Commons. He needs you to pretend to be his captive, as the deal they are selling to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Kreete], head of the Blood Pack, is your head on a plate. But when Kreete and his squad arrive, Narl reveals that Aria's deal was really with Kreete's second, [megametracker://person?id=O3.Gryll]. You and Narl kill Kreete and the other vorcha, and the Blood Pack, under Gryll, falls under Aria's control.

missions.name: Aria: Blue Suns
missions.description:
Aria T'Loak has requested assistance uniting mercenary bands under her control. 

Go speak to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Vosque] at the Citadel docks. He is being investigated by [megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus] and wants you to kill Septimus. When you ask Aria about this, she tells you that all you really have to do is get Septimus to back off. 

Go talk to Septimus in the Presidium Commons and he agrees to back off on the Blue Suns if you can convince the Cipritine Armory Merchant [megametracker://person?id=O3.Kannik] to sell him high-grade arms. 

Kannik says he will only agree to this if you agree to bring him rare artifacts. Find the artifact and give it to Kannik.

options.trigger: (Get artifact for Kannik and notify Oraka.)
"Walk away from this." and (Place a kill order on Oraka.)

missions.name: Aria: Eclipse
missions.description:
Aria T'Loak has requested assistance uniting mercenary bands under her control. 

The Eclipse leader, [megametracker://person?id=O3.Sederis], is currently imprisoned by C-Sec. When you speak to [megametracker://person?A2.Bailey], he says she is a menace and should not be set free. Go talk to her at the C-Sec office in the Presidium Commons and decide for yourself. You can choose to free her anyway, or talk to her second-in-command, [megametracker://person?id=O3.Sayn], at the docks, and convince him to take over the gang.

set.context: Negotiating with Seyn instead of Sederis

missions.name: N7: Cerberus Lab
missions.description: The Alliance has located a new Cerberus laboratory located on Sanctum. Fight off the Cerberus troops and deactivate each containment system and bring the Reaper artifact nearby back to the shuttle.
sideEffects: Journal entries from the Alliance Marine [megametracker://person?id=O3.Talavi]'s brother can be found in the lab.

missions.name: N7: Cerberus Attack
missions.description: Cerberus has taken control of an old military installation on Tuchanka and brought its cannons back up to clear a path for a Cerberus cruiser. Retake the facility and destroy the cruiser.

missions.name: Canon Console
missions.description: Fight your way to the canon control console. Activate the console and Cerberus will cut the power.

missions.name: Power Modules
missions.description: Head back the way you came to the two power modules and shoot off the locks and reactivate them.

missions.name: Shoot Cruiser
missions.description: Activate the control console again and use the canons to shoot down the Cerberus cruiser. If you quickly head outside, you can watch it explode.

missions.name: N7: Cerberus Abductions
missions.description:
Cerberus is attacking civilians on Benning. Provide protection while the civilians are being evacuated. 

Clear out any Cerberus troops in the area, and then take up position to defend the civilians making their way to the landing pad. There will be three waves of Cerberus attacks. Board the shuttle to end the assignment.

events.id: Completed: Attican Traverse: Krogan Team or Tuchanka: Turian Platoon

missions.name: Secure Area
missions.description: Eliminate the first wave of Cerberus on the upper streets.

missions.name: Defend Civilians
missions.description: Head down to the lower streets to defend the civilians and organize an evacuation.

missions.name: Evacuate
missions.description: Help the civilians evacuate and take the shuttle off Benning.

missions.name: N7: Cerberus Fighter Base
missions.description:
Admiral Hackett has asked you to disable a Cerberus fighter base on Noveria. 

Fight your way to the command center. Deactivate the security console. One of your squad will be occupied with the task while the other helps you fight off a new wave of Cerberus troops. When you are finished with them, activate the second console on the left and fight your way back to the landing pad and eliminate the Atlas.

missions.name: N7: Fuel Reactors
missions.description: Investigate why a fuel depot has abruptly gone silent and work with engineer [megametracker://person?id=O3.Riley] to get it working again.

missions.name: Riley
missions.description: Speak to Captain Riley and she will move the container in your path.

missions.name: Move Containers
missions.description: Locate the crane controls and use the buttons to move the two containers in your way to the right (the way you came in).

missions.name: Vent Sector A1
missions.description: Use the console to vent the toxic gas.

missions.name: Fuel Rods
missions.description: Return to the fuel rod control and unlock the fuel rods. Fight off the Reaper attack. After you have cleared the area, you will need to seal the two moderator tanks.

missions.name: Seal Tanks
missions.description: Seal the two moderator tanks.

missions.name: Restart Reactor
missions.description: Restart the reactor. Fight off the Reaper attack. When Riley asks for help, if you ignore her, she will die.

missions.name: Final Startup
missions.description: The doors will open to the reactor. Eliminate the remaining Reaper forces. Initiate the final startup.

missions.name: N7: Communication Hub
missions.description: Cerberus has attacked a comm facility on Ontarom. Prevent them from gaining control of three crucial access points. Deactivate each of the hacking devices using the coordinates sent by [megametracker://person?id=O3.Sato], and rescue Grace.

missions.name: Tuchanka: Turian Platoon
missions.description:
Primarch Victus reports that a turian ship on a secret mission crashed on Tuchanka. Land on Tuchanka to rescue the platoon. 

This mission triggers a countdown for [megametracker://mission?id=A3.Bomb].

set.context: Speaking to Mordin in the War Room afterwards (if this mission was completed before [megametracker://mission?id=A3.KroganTeam]
Speaking to Primarch (Adrien) Victus after the mission

missions.name: Contact Victus Jr.
missions.description: Land on Tuchanka and contact [megametracker://person?id=O3.VictusT]. He will send up a flare directing you where to go next.

missions.name: Escape Pod #1
missions.description: You will be attacked by Cannibals and then by a Harvester. When the Harvester takes 75% damage, it will flee (you get bonus experience if it leaves with the escape pod still intact). The way to the turians is blocked, so turn right instead.

missions.name: Escape Pod #2
missions.description: This time you are attacked by Cannibals and Marauders, and the Harvester drops up some husks. Again your way forward is blocked, so turn right. As you continue, you will have two more smaller skirmishes with the Harvester and dropped troops (husks, Cannibals).

missions.name: Harvester
missions.description: Take down the Harvester, in between waves of Reaper ground troops. When you are finished, go talk to Victus and motivate him into continuing his mission.

missions.name: Tuchanka: Bomb
missions.description:
The turian platoon led by Lieutenant Victus was sent to disarm a devastating turian bomb left on Tuchanka. Stop Cerberus from detonating the bomb and destroying turian-krogan negotiations. Failing to do so will result in a 300 point loss of krogan war assets, and [megametracker://person?id=P3.Eve], if she is on Tuchanka at the time. 

*_This mission will automatically fail if not completed within three missions after [megametracker://mission?id=A3.TurianPlatoon]._*

options.trigger: "You paid a high price." or "We're all lucky."
"Your son fixed this." or "This was a mess."

missions.name: Find Bomb
missions.description: While fighting off Cerberus forces, make your way through the buildings and up to the bomb site.

missions.name: Defend Victus
missions.description: Fight off waves of Cerberus forces while Lieutenant Victus disarms the bomb.

missions.name: Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons
missions.description:
_This mission must be completed before starting [masseffectracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch]._ 

Geth fighter squadrons are targeting quarian liveships with attacks that could cripple the quarian fleet. Disable the server controlling them. 

You will be fighting inside the virtual Geth Consensus. Shoot the orange trails of Reaper code. When you weaken the code enough to disrupt the fighter squadrons, it will mutate and you will have to switch to targeting weak points. At the end, enter the pod and return to reality.

set.context: On the shuttle down, to Legion/Geth VI

options.trigger: "Whatever it takes." or "Sounds like a plan."

set.context: After landing on the planet, to Legion/Geth VI
Before leaving the planet, to Legion/Geth VI

options.trigger: "I'll take your word for it." or "I can sympathize with that."

set.context: Speaking to Admiral Raan on the Normandy, either at the end of Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons or at the end of Rannoch: Admiral Koris (depending on which is completed first)

options.trigger: Tell Legion all the geth must be destroyed.

missions.name: Rannoch: Admiral Koris
missions.description:
_This mission must be completed before starting [masseffectracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch]._ 

The quarian ship carrying [megametracker://person?id=P2.Koris] of the Civilian Fleet has crash-landed on Rannoch. Find him.

set.context: On the shuttle down, to Admiral Xen
When Admiral Koris asks you to save his team instead
Speaking to Admiral Raan on the Normandy, either at the end of Rannoch: Geth Fighter Squadrons or at the end of Rannoch: Admiral Koris (depending on which is completed first)

options.trigger: Tell Legion all the geth must be destroyed.

missions.name: AA Tower 1
missions.description: Follow the path to the jamming tower in the distance until you reach the first AA tower. Clear the area of hostiles. Assign a squad member to take the guns offline while the rest of you defend from a wave of geth. This is followed by another wave of geth, with your whole team back in the fight.

missions.name: Dorn'Hazt
missions.description: Continue following the path to Dorn'Hazt, a wounded quarian from Koris' ship.

missions.name: AA Tower 2
missions.description: This tower has two guns. Again, clear the area and assign a squad member to disable the first gun. Use the station turret to defend against the wave of geth. When they are dispatched, a door will open to the next gun. Clear the area and assign a squad member to disable the second gun while you use the turret to defend against the wave of geth.

missions.name: Jamming Tower
missions.description: [megametracker://person?id=P3.Cortez] takes down the jamming tower. You can finally communicate with Koris. You have to make a choice: to save him or to save his crew.

missions.name: Save Koris (Optional)
missions.description: Koris is a War Asset and keeps the Civilian Fleet from panicking and trying to flee. Additionally, he is a key component to saving Tali's life in [megametracker://mission?id=M3.2.Rannoch].

missions.name: Save Koris' Crew (Optional)
missions.description: This is only a moral victory. Without Koris' leadership, some ships of the Civilian Fleet panic and try to flee, and are cut down by the geth.

missions.name: Dekuuna: Elcor Extraction
missions.description: The elcor have requested an emergency extraction for warriors and civilians trapped on their homeworld of Dekuuna. Search for survivors on Dekuuna, rescue them if possible, and return to the elcor ambassador.

missions.name: Benning: Evidence
missions.description:
Talk to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Osoba] at the Citadel Embassies. He is looking for some remnant of his son, presumed dead on Benning. 

If you miss the dog tags during [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CerberusAbductions], you can purchase them afterwards at the Spectre Requisitions terminal.

missions.name: Grissom Academy: Emergency Evacuation
missions.description: [megametracker://person?id=O3.Sanders] has requested an evacuation of Grissom Academy before the Reapers reach it. However, the turian cruiser that is supposedly responding has a signature suspiciously similar to one known by Cerberus in Game 2. And in fact, when you reach the facility, it is blockaded by Cerberus ships.

options.trigger: "That's dangerous for students." or "What's this about students?"
"Good. We can use them." or "Tell me about the students."

set.context: Before splitting up to attack Cerberus in the atrium

options.trigger: "We'll keep them safe." or (with Jack) "We'll use them as support."
"We'll need their firepower." or (with Jack) "They're ready for battle."

missions.name: Kahlee Sanders
missions.description: Enter the facility and find Sanders. She is besieged by Cerberus in a security office. Help eliminate them. Sanders explains that 20 students are still trapped in the facility.

missions.name: Riley (Optional)
missions.description: Send Riley Bellermine back to Kahlee for help.

missions.name: Seanne (Optional)
missions.description: Send Seanne Bellermine back to Kahlee for help.

missions.name: Orion Hall
missions.description: Make your way to Orion Hall where most of the students are gathered. If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Jack] survived Game 2, she will be leading the students. Otherwise the student [megametracker://person?id=O3.Prangley] is leading the group. After helping them eliminate the Cerberus troops there, you can speak to the students and explore the room.

missions.name: Alternate Route
missions.description: Cerberus has cut off your route back to Cortez. You need to find an alternate route off the station.

missions.name: Atrium 1
missions.description: Head into the atrium for a huge fight with Cerberus, including an Atlas. The atrium is divided in two by a wall, so eliminate the enemies on this side first.

missions.name: Atrium 2
missions.description: Go through the corridor to the other side of the atrium and finish off the troops there.

missions.name: Octavia
missions.description: In the corridors beyond the atrium, you will find a small group of students hiding behind a barrier. If you rescued [megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherD] in Game 2, he will be with them and vouch for you. Otherwise you will need to persuade Octavia to trust you, or shoot through the barrier. If David is there, he will point you to a room with some weapons at the end of the corridor.

missions.name: Atlas
missions.description: There is an empty atlas in this room. You can use it in the final battle if you climb inside.

missions.name: Final Battle
missions.description: When you reach the room with the empty Atlas, you can climb inside and use it for the final battle. When you have eliminated most of the troops, another Atlas will come through and battle you Atlas-to-Atlas. Once it is down, Sanders will usher you on to the waiting shuttle. If Jack is not present, Prangley will die protecting the other students.

missions.name: Shuttle
missions.description: Head through to the shuttle cutscene. If Jack is not present, Sanders will declare that the students are only fit for support roles in the war effort. Otherwise she will leave the decision up to you.

missions.name: Ismar Frontier: Prototype Components
missions.description: A salarian scientist is searching for missing prototypes for a biotic amplification system. Search the Ismar Frontier for the components and return them to the scientist at Huerta Memorial Hospital.

missions.name: Attican Traverse: Krogan Team
missions.description: Investigate a krogan team gone missing while investigating reports of rachni sightings.

options.trigger: "Keep them in line." or "Keep your krogan in line."
"It's over now." or "The Reapers are gone."

set.context: Speaking to Mordin in the War Room afterwards (if this mission was completed before [megametracker://mission?id=A3.TurianPlatoon]

missions.name: Aralakh Company
missions.description: Meet up with Aralakh Company, come to help investigate. If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Grunt] survived Game 2, he will be in the team, otherwise his role is filled by [megametracker://person?id=O3.Dagg].

missions.name: Collapse
missions.description: Crossing the last container will trigger a collapse and you (and the building) will drop down to the rachni tunnels below.

missions.name: Tunnels
missions.description: Aralakh Company will split and travel down a different tunnel. Pick up the M-451 Firestorm to burn through the rachni webbing and enter the tunnels. Burn the rachni eggs also.

missions.name: First Battle
missions.description: Drop down for a big fight in a large cave with Reaper forces.

missions.name: Reaper Node
missions.description:
Shoot the Reaper node to open up the next area. (You can't use the M-451 Firestorm to shoot the nodes.) 

The tunnels collapse behind you when you cross into the next area. You can go right or left, both routes lead through eggs and bring you to the next battle.

missions.name: Second Battle
missions.description: There is a second battle with Reaper forces in this wide area. When they are cleared, drop down the ledge to the area below, and a lot more eggs.

missions.name: Arlakh Company
missions.description: You will head up a series of ledges and then down a long tunnel, before seeing Arlakh across the way, fighting more Reaper forces. Drop down twice more into the shallow lake, and Arlakh will meet you there, by another Reaper node. Shoot this node to continue to the next room. Arlakh will stay behind.

missions.name: Narrow Passage
missions.description: Take the narrow passage down to the central chamber.

missions.name: Central Chamber
missions.description: Three Reaper walls will spring up. You will have to destroy three Reaper nodes to continue, and three waves of Reaper forces.

missions.name: Rachni Queen
missions.description:
If you did not save the [megametracker://person?id=E1.RachniQueen], the rachni queen here is called the "Breeder". 

You must choose whether to save the queen or not. Saving her will sacrifice Aralakh Company. If this is the Breeder, she will also betray you later, so that is not smart. If you save the queen and Grunt was loyal, he will still survive after all the rest of Aralakh Company dies.

missions.name: Arrae: Ex-Cerberus Scientists
missions.description: A group of top-level scientists have cut ties with Cerberus and are fleeing their former employer. Rescue the scientists before Cerberus can find them.

set.context: Speaking to Dr. Cole at the stairs
Trying to recruit Jacob on the shuttle out

missions.name: Entrance
missions.description:
If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Jacob] survived Game2, he will be outside the entrance, injured. Otherwise his role is filled by Dr. Webber. 

Jacob will vouch for you to the scientists inside, but if not, they will be very suspicious of you, requiring you to kill more Cerberus troopers before they open the door.

missions.name: Speak to Cole
missions.description:
[megametracker://person?id=O3.Brynn] is leading the group. You can also talk to [megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherG] - if you saved David at Grissom Academy, he will want to hear about it. 

When you are ready, speak to Dr. Cole and get the task to head up to the roof to repair the satellite and activate the defense guns.
sideEffects: If you romanced Jacob in Game 2, you can have a messy, toxic conversation where you try to win him back ([YouTube|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O8GqKunyspA]).

missions.name: Satellite
missions.description: Repair the telemetry on the satellite dish.

missions.name: AA Tower 1
missions.description: Activate the guns on the first AA tower.

missions.name: Repairs
missions.description: The second AA tower needs repairs, so assign a squad member to repair it while you defend the area from Cerberus.

missions.name: AA Tower 2
missions.description: Activate the guns on the second AA tower.

missions.name: Evacuate
missions.description:
Speak to Dr. Cole to start the evacuation. Head back down to the base entrance and defend the scientists from waves of Cerberus troops. When you destroy the Atlas, Dr. Cole will pick you up in shuttle. 

If Jacob is present, you can speak to him later at Huerta Memorial Hospital.

missions.name: Kallini: Ardat-Yakshi Monastery
missions.description: Asari commandos were sent to rescue or destroy an Ardat-Yakshi monastery besieged by Reaper forces, but they have gone silent. Finish their task. If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Samara] survived Game 2, she will be here on a similar purpose.

options.trigger: "Bombs are a last resort." or "We don't know that."
"Then neither do we." or "Then we put them down."

missions.name: Asari Commando
missions.description:
Head into the monastery. The elevator is out, so you have to take the access shaft ladders down to an open floor. Inside, you find the corpse of a commando. 

When you go past and across the observation deck, you will encounter [megametracker://person?id=S2.Samara] (if she survived Game 2) on the level below. She will go ahead to the Great Hall, leaving you to catch up.

missions.name: Courtyard
missions.description: Head down the curving stair to the courtyard. As you cross the garden space back toward the building, Reaper forces will attack, including a Banshee.

missions.name: Balcony
missions.description:
Back inside, you are on a wrapped balcony overlooking a large water feature. [megametracker://person?id=O3.Falere] is here, fighting off a Cannibal. She heads to the Great Hall to find her sister. If Samara is here, she will levitate down and follow. 

Unfortunately, the elevator is broken, so your team has to follow the long way.

missions.name: Antechamber
missions.description:
Head right down the hallway and down the stairs to a large garden space, and another battle with another Banshee. 

The water feature is in the room beyond, along with another dead asari commando.
sideEffects: If you did not kill [megametracker://person?id=E2.Morinth] in Game 2, she will be mentioned in the logs here as trying to contact her sisters.

missions.name: Great Hall
missions.description: Take the elevator to the Great Hall. At the end of the hall, you find the bomb left by the commandos, and [megametracker://person?id=O3.Rila]. When you activate the bomb, Rila - partially Indoctrinated - will attack Falere and have to be knocked unconscious. As you look for a detonator for the bomb, Banshees and Husks show up.

missions.name: Destroy Monastery
missions.description:
Rila finds the detonator, but refuses to leave with you. You must drag Falere away to the elevator. Banshees swarm the room and attack Rila, but she detonates the bomb before she dies. 

If Samara is present, she will then attempt to shoot herself, to avoid having to kill Falere (who is now a threat, as an Ardat-Yakshi without a monastery). If you have the reputation, you can stop her. If Samara is not present, you decide whether to let Falere live.
